text:
I love this place.  I have bars walking distance from my house, but I go out of my way to come here (have to Uber it home, but it is worth it!).  Fantastic Happy Hour prices, and great customer service.

All the bartenders and manager are awesome, especially Jeff and Colleen!

Thank you very much for being my go-to bar.

I had a good time here, the room was a bit dark for me but it could have just been the time I went. I gambled a bit and won some money and they comp. your drinks if you're gambling (which is customary in Vegas). I didn't try the food but everyone I went with had a good time I would definitely go there again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good chill place to gamble and drink at.

Yeah. Not too impressed. Overpriced, bad breakfast. The server was very nice. I love a good dive bar. Perhaps if they stepped up on the quality of the food, I'd return. But with so many other options in Seattle, I doubt I'd visit again.
My favorite football and after-party party spot! Plus after midnight they have $1 tap beers and a good food menu!

Matty may be Mad but this place makes me :)  ..One day while driving down Sahara looking for lunch I see Wendy's and think nahhh. I happen upon Mad Matty's Bar and Grille next door and decided to try it out (love their witty comments on their LED scrolling sign such as "oh cool, a bus lane! note: this was during the bus lane construction on Sahara and later "wasn't construction over weeks ago" -about the delay in completion).
Anyway, the place is dim and full of video poker and slots just like any other casino-bar, but as soon as i walk in i'm greeted with a warm welcome by the bartenders.  Both of them were really friendly and we even shared a few laughs while i ordered.  I got the mad matty's burger (typical bar food) but not so typical burger! for about the same price as Wendys next door, i Got a huge 1/2 lb burger with cheese, fries and ranch!

A chill place with a good burger! So if you're looking for a good burger fix in the area, opt out of typical fast food and grab one at Mad Matty's.  You'll also get better service and friendly bartenders! Sit back, sip a few beers, and good luck hitting that royal flush playing deuces wild!

Since our b-fast fiasco we've been back to Matty's several times. (not for b-fast). The afternoon/evening service is very good. The latest dinner was the Blu cheese/mushroom steak. Yumm. The bartender was super and treated us as 'regulars'. He helped the wife with a new players card. Also the remodel of the dining room is really nice, stonework and more tables by the windows. Bottom line....we'll be authentic 'regulars' at Matty's.

Dear mad Maddys 

why anyone would wanna come to your bar is besides me!  You have the absolute worst service from any bartender I've ever been to at any bar not only in this time but anywhere in the United States. I encourage anybody looking for a new neighborhood bar or even a bar to please avoid mad Maddys at all costs! This bar on Sahara is the absolute worst waste of space waste of staff and waste of time I've ever been to I would offer you less than one star if I could but unfortunately up only lets me do one please revisit your staff training on how to say hi and welcome new customers and management you really should do more to oversee your staff the reason why no cars are ever in your parking lot because you all are just the worst waste of space ever. Nothing more to add to this yelp review with I hope everyone reading this will avoid mad Matty's at any cost.

This is my go-to place when I'm having a rough day.  The waitresses always provide good service.  The fries are fantastic, as is all of the food I've tried.  My favorites are the tuna melt and the turkey croissant.  There is no glass separating the casino from the restaurant.  Even though I hate cigarette smoke, it doesn't bother me here--just another way to keep the screaming kids away.
Great food, good service. This place is great! Has a comfy atmosphere and happy employees. Glad I found this place!

Randomly came here to eat and ended up having a drink due to awesome happy hour. Loved it! Impressed with the food- exceeded expectations for both me and my partner in crime. We had flatbread, fried zucchini, burger, onion rings. Even the coca cola tasted really good somehow?? The vibe is hole-in-the-wall tavern-like with gambling. I enjoyed that because I miss the tiny divey bars from living outside of Vegas. Good service - bartender was chill and helpful. Would come back!

Sunday morning quiet coupled with great food and a pleasant wait staff makes Mad Matty's a standard stop for us when we're in Vegas. We've only hit them for breakfast, but judging from other reviews our experience is echoed by others. Definitely worth a stop!

Has a cool 70s retro feel, but not like crappy old. More like Mad Men or any tv show set in the 70s. Got a 1/2 pound burger and fries for 6.50. Pretty good. Happy hour is 4-7 with $2 drafts. Service isn't the fastest. Seriously. Don't come here if you have a short lunch break. Would probably come back.

Since the management change, there has been a major change in the menu. As others have mentioned, no more prime rib special. Also no more chicken-fried steak; and fewer Mexican dishes. However, the burgers are still terrific.
One positive change is that appetizers and flatbreads--along with draft beer--are half price until 7 p.m. So you can come here and get a casual dinner and drink for a really good price. [They also have a half-price breakfast deal, right at breakfast time, so that's nice to know.]
However, I'm downgrading them a star because since the mgt. change, they've closed their non-smoking section off. Now we have to eat in the regular, very smoky bar section. Being a non-smoker, I really don't want to do that; and will probably not be coming here as much; unless I find out they've re-opened their nice dining section.

Been frequenting Mattys going on 8 years now so as you can imagine it's definitely a special place indeed. 

Over the years the original bartenders and staff have moved on and things have changed in terms of the interior and service quality. 5 stars for our originals, Stan, Sheila, Big John (R.I.P.), Art, Eddie, Erin and Dina.  

Their original menu never disappointed and you'd be hard-pressed to find anything less than good back in the day (5 stars there). Apparently management has decided to downsize the menu and do away with almost 90% of the items which has regulars less than satisfied. 

As of January 1st, management has decided to shut down the dining area and renovate in hopes that they can appeal to a younger crowd with more of a lounge feel near the fireplace. Have to keep up with the times I guess. I get that. Fingers crossed things go well. 

At the end of the day, let's see how the place goes after the renovations have been completed as it's too early to tell what the outcome will be. 

Regardless, I'll still be paying a yearly visit just for the memories and a cocktail or two.
Still our favorite brunch location.  We have come here for years, the brunch price has gone up and come back down. Still a great value, food is the same every time.  Love it.

Well, I tried again on Thanksgiving to sample the food - Yuk, Ugg, and whatever else you can say about this nasty dinner!! Management just doesn't get it I guess. It was completely overwhelmed with SALT. Everything was brutally over salted. The gravy, the stuffing, and the mashed potatoes. My ankles were actually swollen on Friday morning. The bartenders agreed with me after tasting the food. This is exactly why you don't see many cars in the parking lot. That's it for me - no more visits to Mad Matty's. The bartenders were great and the drinks were made perfectly - but the food,arghh!! This used to be a great place for food and beverage. They need to get Bobby Flay in there to show these idiots in the kitchen how to cook. Goodbye!!

Ok first time there. The blonde long hair older lady so rude to me.played keno 60 lost lost.went to new  machine  i won. How this everyone wants to be nice  when you expect a tip . I always tip to nice bartender s this was not one but when i won the owner came over was very nice so i tip 60. Tha old blonde bartender bad mouthed me. Nice . Oh maybe if she was not a bitch she would have got more .this place a bad bad place to hang.

2 stars because of the mgmt change. Don't read this wrong cuz the service, staff, facility is really nice. HOWEVER... I'm Sooooo upset about the menu change with the new mgmt. This place had the BEST French Dip and chicken fingers and they don't offer it anymore. Also as a non smoker, it sucks since they opened up the smoking section everywhere so you'll sit there and eat in a cloud of smoke... Sadly, this will be my last visit, mainly because they don't serve The best French dip anymore... This is now just a average bar
Great place to revisit if you haven't been here in awhile.  Good food, service and atmosphere.  Matty burger is delicious and almost enough for 2. Definitely will be back.

Cheapest drinks I've ever had in Vegas, friendly bar staff and food is pretty decent too. Great place to go after work on a long day, or for late-night gatherings. 

Solid local spot for the west Vegas crowd and a staple of my occasional cheap drinks with friends on a weeknight or whenever!
Nice Locals spot. My first time there for breakfast. Very Good. Anne my server was just about Perfect. Great Customer service and wi return soon.

ordered the street tacos - could barely see the tortillas. Very small - for $12 - 3 tacos, with pico, sour cream and guacamole, and a smashed bit of fried beans with cheese on it and about 6 tortillas chips.  Not worth it.  Not the Matty's it was 5 years ago.  Hasn't been the same since Matty died. - Really a shame.....
I just learned this morning about "no more prime-rib." May as well just go to PT's. Same smell and much closer. Very very not happy.

The food here is amazing. And it's very well priced too! The gaming is better than most places I go. But mostly, the staff is incredible. They are funny, kind, quick, and always ready with what you need. Best bar I've been to in a long time. NFL game action with Sunday ticket and fantastic mimosas make a great Sunday morning. The bartenders are awesome!!

This is definitely worth trying out. My first time for breakfast. Adela was friendly.  The omlette was good and the food cooked with competence.  The prices are amazingly affordable.  And they have TV for the sports fans.

I'm surprised this place doesn't have a review yet. It is considered a "casino" with video poker and various slot machines that I haven't touched (I'm not a gambler), with restaurant seating and bar. Every time I've been in here so far (3x), I've never seen the restaurant side open. The place is 24 hours, and the best part is that their full menu is available 24 hours as well. I noticed a lot of places will close their kitchen during the later hours of the night, and that's no good for people like me who get the munchies after a fun night out. 

It's a very mellow place and so far it looks like only locals come in, so don't expect speedy service. It's good service...but more like 'lax service. Plus they usually only have 1 or 2 guys running the entire place. The food comes out pretty fast after you order, but this is the kind of place that won't give you the check unless you ask for it. One time, I finished my meal and just sat and watched TV/played on my phone/chilled for a good thirty minutes before I finally told one of the bartenders I would like to pay. 

The food is great too. There is a bunch of items I haven't tried yet but what I have tried has been very good (the potato cheddar soup, bbq ribs, cheesecake a la mode, and few appetizers). I love fries, and theirs are perfect: crisp, hot, and well-seasoned. They have a full menu including breakfast which I am determined to go back and try one of these days.

So if you got the drunchies (drunk munchies) or just want a midnight snack, Mad Matty's the perfect place to just relax and fill up before you return to your humble abode.

This place is the best place to gamble off the strip if you want the bar environment with casion slots. The bartenders are great, the food is AMAZING and they have a good progressive. Its open 24hrs and the food is also 24hrs. They don't have pool tables or darts, but if you want to hang out and gamble or have great food while watching the game you should go here.

Totally surprised with the quality of the food! My boyfriend and I ended up going here when we were hungry and broke. We had an expired Groupon and happened to go during happy hour! How perfect?

We ended up ordering quite a few delicious things that were all filling for super cheap. For an appetizer, we got nachos with the chicken on the side. It was a huge portion for only a few dollars. My boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sliders (they come with fries) and I ordered a Mediterranean pizza with no olives.

The pizza was a perfect portion and my boyfriend liked the sliders quite a bit. The fries were PERFECT. I can't stress that enough. I could order those by the bucket. They were crispy on the outside but not too crispy on the inside. Perfect taste!

The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because of the service. We didn't get noticed for a few minutes but there was only one other party of about 6 people there. Our waiter was nice once we were seated though!

We got a Groupon to try this place out for the first time... Our first indicator that we should be worried was that at NOON on the Friday we gave them a try there was but a single other car in the parking lot - NOT usually a good thing. On the entry doors was a big sign advertising their "Prime Rib Special" for $9.99.  Inside was as dark as a bar usually is but well decorated with more than a dozen 4-person tables in a separate dining area. We were greeted by the sole waitress/hostess who was serving the only other customers and we were told to pick a table. We didn't see a bartender at any time while we were there. Our waitress (ADEL) brought us menus and took our drink order. When she came back I asked whether she recommended the Prime Rib Special and she said that it was great but that they also had a shrimp special that day too. As I love prime rib and trusting her very positive endorsement I ordered the 'double-cut' for $14.99 and my friend got a French Dip sandwich. When I asked for the baked potato offered as one of my sides Adel said that they were "pre-baked and would be microwaved to heat it up" but would still be very good! I'll cut to the chase here - I asked for rare to medium-rare and I got a piece of grisly pan seared meat that was truly tough to even cut with the knife. Under the 'main' piece of meat which was medium to well done was a much smaller piece of seared meat that was well done - I guess it was supposed to be my 'double cut' serving! Only once in my 60 years have I sent a piece of meat back but even my friend tried the meat and agreed that it was not edible!  We called our waitress and she took a look, apologized, and said she would get me another piece of meat. I said that if it was also going to be pan fried I would rather just get a burger instead. Sandwich prices are high and as stated my
special was anything but special! Even though our server was a truly nice lady I would never go back here even with a Groupon. It was a BAD experience. ALWAYS pay attention to the parking lot = the rest of the people in the area were giving us a hint!

Came here because I purchased a Groupon. I do not live in this part of town, but I wish I was nearby because it is a decent enough neighborhood spot. The bartenders were super sweet and attentive. Many tv's on for my ESPN fix. I ordered their prime rib which is only $10 and it did not disappoint. I chose the shrimp albondigas soup, and I really liked it. Broth-y but generous with the shrimp meatballs. The prime rib came with garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. Great service and decent prices.

Great drink specials, but not so great food. 

Happy hour here is from 3pm-7pm, and it's half off ALL alcohol and appetizers. Let me say that again, HALF OFF ALL ALCOHOL. Pretty unbeatable for drink specials. 

The food is another story. We ordered mac n cheese balls, flat breads, fried calamari, and nachos.

Mac n cheese balls
These aren't what you're thinking. They are two giant balls of lightly fried mac n cheese covered in marinara sauce. The marinara sauce was super overpowering to some really mediocre mac n cheese.

Fried calamari
Such a shame. Very very very overcooked. Barely any breading on it. It was super tough to eat and very rubbery. I finished it only because I hate wasting the life of any animal that has found its way to my plate.

Flatbreads
Not great. Crust was burnt in places. Ordinary marinara sauce and giant blobs of mozzarella. 

Nachos
Exactly how you could make them at home. 

The food was incredibly disappointing and took a long time as well. You can get much better at Steiners, Rounders, or similar. I hate to write a bad review, but I have to be honest about the quality here. 

I would most likely come back for their awesome happy hour. The wait staff was friendly, funny, and quick with the drink services.
Mattys burger!!!! All the way..oh ya Johns cool too ;-) xo

This place sucks besides shitty food the bartenders are the worst especially that bartender with the beard who thinks he is gods gift. They are a bunch of cry babies and I hope they stay slow cause they suck and don't deserve service.

Why do you change a good thing?? You were known for your Prime Rib special and very good albondigas soup (I actually thought your soup was better than the mexican cantina restaurant at suncoast AND better than Juan's Flaming Fajitas.) 

But when we came here a few nights ago, your whole menu was changed, you removed the prime rib (should've left it on)  We were a party of 4 and we've been here several several times and this time, we all got up and walked out! 

I can get regular bar food ANYWHERE!  

Who ever is making these changes, better fix something real fast because you're losing customers. 

READ YOUR REVIEWS!!

You're not the only place in this city to get a decent prime rib dinner.  

Now you're nothing special, same bar menu like every place in town, we have no reason to come here now.

BYE....
Lived in Vegas 30 years. First time here. Ordered some sampler appetizer and wine for two of us. Gambled, comp wine. Sampler $5 bucks, happy hour, 3-7, half price. Jason was cool. 30 machines.

I have only been to Marty's once but can tell you I like vet this place.  It definitely has the feeling of an older Las Vegas gaming bar or tavern.  Frequented by a lot of locals, all of the servers knew the names of almost everyone in there.

There is a middle island where I sat and played, and I will attach some photos of how I did!  Really enjoyed gambling here and would recommend to anyone on the north west side of town.

The food was above average.  Went with a burger, fries and salad, and it was cooked perfectly and thoroughly enjoyed it.  

What I really love was the service.  They take care of their customers and gamers.  From the bar backs to the servers and bar tenders, all of them were on their game, even though it was 2:30 on a Thursday afternoon!  Would totally come here again if I lived closer.

The only reason it wasn't five stars was because it was a tad bit smiley, but when you are hitting jackpots, it doesn't matter!

Just stopped in to relax after work w/a few friends. They changed their menu and I was a little skeptical bc I always ordered the same thing to eat but was no longer on the menu. To my surprise the new menu offers a lot of great food. We had the caprese salad, flatbread pizza, and some calamari...all was very good. The service w/Jason and Katrina was excellent as always.

Lots of machines,large bar,great food and service. I've been coming here for years,
When I'm close I always swing in for breakfast or lunch.
The food they offer here on their menu is honestly trash. It's not even good when your drunk or catching a buzz! Staff here are all rude as well! Wouldn't spend any time here!
